question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
What is $\dbinom{n}{n-1}$ for any positive integer $n$?  (Answer in terms of $n$.)
inference:
$\binom{n}{n-1} = \frac{n!}{(n-1)!(n-(n-1))!} = \frac{n!}{(n-1)!1!} = \frac{n(n-1)!}{(n-1)!1} = n$

Final Answer: $\boxed{n}$ I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
\begin{align*}
\dbinom{n}{n-1}&=\dfrac{n!}{(n-1)!~1!}\\
&=\dfrac{n\times(n-1)\times(n-2)\times(n-3)\times\cdots\times 2\times 1}{(n-1)\times (n-2)\times (n-3)\times \cdots \times 2\times 1}\\
&=\boxed{n}.
\end{align*}Also, $\binom{n}{n-1}$ is the number of ways to choose $n-1$ objects out of $n$.  This is equivalent to choosing $1$ object not to use.  Since there are $n$ different objects, there are $\boxed{n}$ ways to do this.
